<h1 align="center">
  Kobi Gatsby
</h1>

Static site version of Kobi using React Gatsby, allowing better performance and versatility. 

## ğŸš€ Start Developing

1.  Clone this repository to your device.

2.  **Start developing.**

    Open the folder in your favorite text editor and run the following command.

    ```shell
    gatsby develop *or* npm run develop
    ```

3.  **Open the source code and start editing!**

    Your site is now running at `http://localhost:8000`!

    _Note: We'll also have a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you we use to query our Wordpress data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby Tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/tutorial/part-4/#use-graphiql-to-explore-the-data-layer-and-write-graphql-queries)._

  
## ğŸ§ What's inside?

A quick look at the top-level files and directories you'll see in a Gatsby project.

    .
    â”œâ”€â”€ node_modules
    â”œâ”€â”€ src
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€components
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€pages
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€images
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€styles
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€templates 
    â”œâ”€â”€ .gitignore
    â”œâ”€â”€ .prettierrc
    â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-browser.js
    â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-config.js
    â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-node.js
    â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-ssr.js
    â”œâ”€â”€ LICENSE
    â”œâ”€â”€ package-lock.json
    â”œâ”€â”€ package.json
    â””â”€â”€ README.md

1.  **`/node_modules`**: This directory contains all of the modules of code that your project depends on (npm packages) are automatically installed.

2.  **`/src`**: This directory will contain all of the code related to what you will see on the front-end of your site (what you see in the browser) such as your site header or a page template. `src` is a convention for â€œsource codeâ€.
    a. **`/src/pages`** is where we save the pages used in our project. This folder is also where the routing is configured.
    b. **`/src/templates`** is where we save the templates used in for our page generation.
    c. **`/src/components`** is where we save reusable component modules for our project.
    d. **`/src/styles`** is where we save the styling/css used in our project.
    e. **`/src/images`** is where we save the images used in our project.
    
3.  **`gatsby-config.js`**: This is the main configuration file for a Gatsby site. This is where you can specify information about your site (metadata) like the site title and description, which Gatsby plugins youâ€™d like to include, etc. (Check out the [config docs](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/config-files/gatsby-config/) for more detail).

4.  **`gatsby-node.js`**: We use Gatsby Node to generate static pages based on GraphiQL query results. Look here for further information [Gatsby Node APIs](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/config-files/gatsby-node/).

That'll be all the components that we're using in Kobi-Gatsby.

## ğŸ“ Learning Gatsby

Looking for more guidance? Full documentation for Gatsby lives [on the website](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/). Here are some places to start:

- **For most developers, we recommend starting with our [in-depth tutorial for creating a site with Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/tutorial/).** It starts with zero assumptions about your level of ability and walks through every step of the process.

- **To dive straight into code samples, head [to our documentation](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/).** In particular, check out the _Guides_, _API Reference_, and _Advanced Tutorials_ sections in the sidebar.

We're currently deploying to Netlify.
